body: Closing this as RAT is still generating the report file in fineract-provider/build/report/rat/
I pulled and ran the build.  It works for me.  The change is also simple.
@myrle-krantz Thank you :-). I will merge these changes today.
Closing this PR as there is conflict in the changed file.
Change looks good.
Changes Looks OK.
Changes Looks OK
@ThisuraThejith  As specified in the email response, we are more interested in security vulnerabilities rather than code quality.
Not able to build with OpenJPA as new JPA entities are extending from AbstractPersistable. Review will be started only post to these changes on entities.
@nazeer1100126, i forgot to make the OpenJpa Changes when make the changes you had suggested early. I have now done the necessary OpenJpa Changes and sending a new PR.
@nazeer1100126, I have made OpenJpa Changes you can now review
@tonic889 I have already done the changes and sent a PR  on the same. Please look at https://github.com/apache/incubator-fineract/pull/313

Closing this PR as a new PR has been raised for the requirement:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-fineract/pull/320
@ThisuraThejith Please close this PR as we are not expecting coding style changes.

Changes Looks OK. But instead of writing code similar to existing loan product mix implementation, you should have extended by adding entity type. By extending existing implementation, you should have avoided lot of duplicate/similar code.
Closed upon request.
This is a nice start, but we should also make sure we are not getting statements as mentioned here ... https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SQL_injection#Technical_implementations
So what is the right way to avoid this duplication of effort again in the future?
This is merged. Due to sync issue it is not reflecting here.
Apologies submitted PR on wrong repo
Looks good to me
@nikpawar89 Please follow coding style defined by https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html

@nikpawar89 Please let me know whether I understood correctly. With this implementation, I can define credit bureau, credit bureau products and map them to a loan product. So where is actual credit bureau high level check implementation so that anybody can attach specific provider implementation?

@nazeer1100126  This module is intended for configuring the credit bureau. Once the credit bureau is mapped to a specific loan product, i'll be using this configuration to map the credit check request with specific credit bureau.The code for mapping credit check with credit bureau is not included in this module, it will be included with each specific implementation of the credit bureau in CreditBureauConfigurationAPI.java
reponening
hi, is this feature still being used? i have a query regarding it, let me know if it is. thanks.
@ThisuraThejith Changes are OK.
Changes are OK. But it is having two commits.
@nazeer1100126 , how about validation in SavingsAccountTransactionDataValidator class? Not necessary?
@Ippezrobert can you give some more details? What validations should we do in SavingsAccountTransactionDataValidator ?

_final String note = this.fromApiJsonHelper.extractStringNamed(noteParamName, element);
        baseDataValidator.reset().parameter(noteParamName).value(note).notExceedingLengthOf(1000);_

Because i tried the above PR locally here but doesn't work still throws error below from Web App

_field is required
The parameter `note` has been passed and is not supported for this request._ 

OR
Could it be that some changes need to be done at the community-app too?
ah got it. He didn't add noteParamName in supported parameter list

@nazeer1100126 , I added the above validation as in this commit https://github.com/Ippezrobert/incubator-fineract/commit/e329b5d9fad3325217ff1c4e556250ae592d19eb but still community-app throws the error 

_> field is required
> The parameter note has been passed and is not supported for this request._

Could you please try this at your side maybe you will see where the error is.
Thanks
@Ippezrobert You need to add that note parameter to SavingsApiConstants.SAVINGS_ACCOUNT_TRANSACTION_REQUEST_DATA_PARAMETERS

@nazeer1100126, I got it working now. Thank you for guiding me
You can close this PR as i send a new working PR with all the necessary changes

Thank you very much @nazeer1100126. Based on the feedback from Mark, it seems adding new constant classes isn't a problem at this stage. I am working on that at the moment. What is your idea about that?
@Sanyam thank you
@raj140916 thank you
@Ippezrobert Don't we require to show this note in the UI when user is selecting these transactions?
@nazeer1100126 , there is a PR i sent for the UI https://github.com/openMF/community-app/pull/2191. Hope this is what you meant.
@Ippezrobert in this screen https://demo.openmf.org/#/viewsavingtrxn/790/trxnId/9212

@nazeer1100126 , Yes i get it. Indeed we need to show it in th above UI and i was thinking also in transaction tab https://demo.openmf.org/#/viewsavingaccount/790 as in this https://mifosforge.jira.com/secure/attachment/32487/Savings%20Trans%23%20View.png and https://mifosforge.jira.com/secure/attachment/32488/Loan%20Trans%23%20View.png
@Ippezrobert are you going to add this and send another PR?
@nazeer1100126 , you can guide me of which changes or files are affected and i can add it as before and send a PR. Waiting for your guidance
@iamrupok This PR has conflicts and other changes (66 commits). You should send PR with your changes only.
@Ippezrobert can we discuss on Skype ?

@iamrupok Yes, only committers will have push permission. You need to send PR to this repo.
1) Checkout a local branch from this repo and do the changes. add the changes and then commit them
2) Push that local branch to your forked repository
3)  Login into your forked repository. Send PR from newly pushed branch.

@iamrupok Looks like you have created local branch from https://github.com/openmf/incubator-fineract.
You should create local branch from https://github.com/apache/fineract

git push --set-upstream origin adhocquery
remote: Permission to apache/fineract.git denied to iamrupok.
fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/apache/fineract/': The
requested URL returned error: 403

Prerequisites:
origin  https://github.com/{yourusername}/fineract (This should have forked from https://github.com/apache/fineract)
upstream https://github.com/apache/fineract

//Commands to follow
git add --all
git commit -m "commit details"
git fetch upstream
git rebase upstream/develop
gradlew clean integrationTest
git push origin branch-name
and then go to https://github.com/{yourusername}/fineract -> branches -> select your branch -> create Pull Request
@nazeer1100126 I have updated the PR adding three new constant classes. Can you please review it.
@iamrupok close this PR
You need to modify appContext.xml. You need to add this new package to bean scan and you need to add repository package also. Please include this xml as part of next PR

> +
> +        this.context.authenticatedUser();
> +

> +
> +        final AdHocData adhoc = this.adHocReadPlatformService.retrieveOne(adHocId);
> +
> +        return this.toApiJsonSerializer.serialize(settings, adhoc, this.RESPONSE_DATA_PARAMETERS);
> +    }
> +

> RoleNotFoundException?

PR 373 is for FINERACT-482. It allows client to block/unblock savings account, debit transactions or credit transactions. 
Client can also hold and release amount.
It is a basic feature and can be extended later.
